elliott-wave-introduction.title: Introduction to Elliott Wave Theory
elliott-wave-introduction.excerpt: A comprehensive overview of Elliott Wave Theory and its application in modern Forex market analysis.
elliott-wave-introduction.content:
Elliott Wave Theory is one of the most sophisticated methods of technical analysis, developed by Ralph Nelson Elliott in the 1930s. This methodology provides a framework for understanding market psychology and price movements.

## The Foundation of Wave Theory

At its core, Elliott Wave Theory suggests that market prices move in predictable patterns called waves. These patterns reflect the collective psychology of market participants and tend to repeat across different timeframes.

## Five-Wave and Three-Wave Patterns

The basic structure consists of five-wave impulse moves in the direction of the main trend, followed by three-wave corrective moves against the trend. Understanding these patterns helps analysts identify potential turning points and forecast future price movements.

## Application in Forex Markets

In the Forex market, Elliott Wave analysis is particularly effective due to the market's high liquidity and continuous trading. Waves Logix applies this methodology alongside quantitative validation to enhance accuracy.

### Key Benefits

Elliott Wave analysis provides clear invalidation levels, helping traders manage risk effectively. When combined with macroeconomic analysis, it offers a comprehensive view of market structure.
elliott-wave-introduction.author: Waves Logix Research

forex-market-structure.title: Understanding Forex Market Structure
forex-market-structure.excerpt: How institutional traders analyze market structure and liquidity zones for better trading decisions.
forex-market-structure.content:
Market structure analysis is fundamental to professional Forex trading. Understanding how prices move and where liquidity concentrates gives traders a significant edge.

## What is Market Structure?

Market structure refers to the pattern of higher highs, higher lows (uptrend) or lower highs, lower lows (downtrend) that prices create over time. This simple concept forms the foundation of trend analysis.

## Liquidity Zones

Liquidity zones are areas where significant buy or sell orders are concentrated. These often form around previous swing highs and lows, round numbers, and technical levels.

## Institutional vs. Retail Perspective

Institutional traders often target areas where retail traders place their stop losses. Understanding this dynamic helps professional traders position themselves more effectively.

### Practical Application

At Waves Logix, we combine market structure analysis with wave-based methodologies to identify high-probability trading scenarios. This integrated approach provides clarity in complex market conditions.
forex-market-structure.author: Waves Logix Research

risk-management-principles.title: Professional Risk Management Principles
risk-management-principles.excerpt: Essential risk management strategies for protecting capital in volatile Forex markets.
risk-management-principles.content:
Effective risk management is the cornerstone of long-term trading success. Without proper risk controls, even the best analysis can lead to significant losses.

## Position Sizing Fundamentals

Position sizing determines how much capital to risk on each trade. Professional traders typically risk 1-2% of their account per trade, allowing them to survive losing streaks.

## Stop Loss Strategies

Stop losses should be placed at logical technical levels where the trade thesis is invalidated. This approach ensures that stops are meaningful rather than arbitrary.

## Correlation Management

In Forex trading, many currency pairs are correlated. Trading multiple correlated positions effectively increases your risk exposure. Managing correlation is essential for portfolio stability.

### The Role of Advisory Support

Waves Logix provides advisory support that includes risk management frameworks tailored to individual client profiles. This personalized approach helps clients maintain discipline and protect their capital.
risk-management-principles.author: Waves Logix Research

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our services, advisory model, and how we work with clients.
faq.disclaimerText: The information provided on this page is for informational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice or a recommendation to buy or sell any financial instrument. Trading involves risk and may result in loss of capital.

items.question: What is Waves Logix?
items.answer: Waves Logix is an independent analytical and advisory firm providing market analysis and non-discretionary advisory support in Forex, gold, and oil markets.

items.question: Is Waves Logix an asset management company?
items.answer: No. Waves Logix does not provide asset management or discretionary portfolio management services.

items.question: Do you manage or control client funds?
items.answer: No. Client funds always remain under the client's full control within their brokerage account.

items.question: Do you execute trades on behalf of clients?
items.answer: No. We do not execute trades or place orders unless explicitly authorized under a limited power of attorney, and only with client consent.

items.question: Do you accept deposits or hold client money?
items.answer: No. Waves Logix does not accept, hold, or custody client funds.

items.question: Can Waves Logix access my brokerage account?
items.answer: Only if explicitly authorized and within defined limits.

items.question: Can I withdraw funds at any time?
items.answer: Yes. Clients retain full withdrawal rights at all times.

items.question: What services does Waves Logix provide?
items.answer: We provide market analysis, analytical research, and non-discretionary advisory support related to Forex, gold, and oil markets.

items.question: Who are your services designed for?
items.answer: Our services are designed for professional traders, high-net-worth individuals, and brokerage companies.

items.question: Is there a minimum capital requirement?
items.answer: Yes. Advisory services are typically offered to clients with capital starting from $300,000.

items.question: Do you provide services to retail investors?
items.answer: No. We do not offer mass-market or retail investment services.

items.question: Is your service suitable for brokerage companies?
items.answer: Yes. We work with brokerage firms and internal analyst teams requiring external analytical support.

items.question: Do you offer education or training?
items.answer: Educational explanations may be provided as part of advisory communication.

items.question: Do you provide investment advice?
items.answer: We provide analytical and advisory information only. All final investment decisions remain the responsibility of the client.

items.question: Is your analysis regulated financial advice?
items.answer: No. Our analysis is informational and advisory in nature and does not constitute regulated financial advice.

items.question: Do you guarantee profits or performance?
items.answer: No. We do not guarantee results or profitability.

items.question: What markets do you cover?
items.answer: We specialize in Forex, gold, and oil markets.

items.question: Do you provide stock or equity analysis?
items.answer: No. We do not provide analysis or advisory services related to equities or stock markets.

items.question: How is your analysis created?
items.answer: Our analysis combines technical analysis, wave-based methodologies, macroeconomic research, and AI-assisted data processing.

items.question: Do you use artificial intelligence?
items.answer: Yes. AI tools are used to support data processing and scenario validation, while final conclusions are made by human analysts.

items.question: Who is responsible for final analytical decisions?
items.answer: All final conclusions are reviewed and approved by experienced human analysts.

items.question: How is risk addressed in your analysis?
items.answer: Risk considerations are incorporated through volatility assessment, structural boundaries, and scenario invalidation levels.

items.question: Can your analysis be customized?
items.answer: Yes. Analytical output can be adapted to specific trading styles, instruments, and timeframes.

items.question: Do you provide trading signals?
items.answer: We provide analytical insights and structured scenarios, not automated or guaranteed trading signals.

items.question: How often is analysis provided?
items.answer: Frequency depends on the service agreement and market conditions.

items.question: How do clients receive analysis?
items.answer: Analysis is delivered through written reports, charts, and structured updates.

items.question: Is Waves Logix legally incorporated?
items.answer: Yes. Waves Logix Ltd. is a legally incorporated company.

items.question: Can I verify your company registration?
items.answer: Yes. Corporate documentation can be reviewed upon request.

items.question: Are you licensed as an investment manager?
items.answer: No. Waves Logix is not licensed as an asset manager.

items.question: Do you require a contract?
items.answer: Yes. All cooperation is governed by a formal agreement.

items.question: Is your service compliant with international standards?
items.answer: Yes. Our operations are structured to align with applicable international legal and compliance standards.

items.question: Do you operate globally?
items.answer: Yes. We work with international clients, subject to legal and jurisdictional considerations.

items.question: Is your service suitable for UK-based clients?
items.answer: Yes, provided services are used in an advisory, non-discretionary capacity.

items.question: Does Waves Logix provide regulated financial promotions?
items.answer: No. We do not issue regulated financial promotions.

items.question: Where can I find legal disclaimers?
items.answer: Legal disclaimers are published on our website and included in service agreements.

items.question: How are fees structured?
items.answer: Fees depend on the service model and may be performance-based where legally permitted.

items.question: Are fees charged if no profit is generated?
items.answer: Fee terms are defined contractually and may vary by service.

items.question: Is client information confidential?
items.answer: Yes. All client information is handled with strict confidentiality.

items.question: Do you share client data with third parties?
items.answer: No. Client data is not shared except where legally required.

items.question: Can your analysis be used for automated trading?
items.answer: Our analysis is not designed as an automated trading system.

items.question: How do you avoid conflicts of interest?
items.answer: We do not trade against clients or profit from client losses.

items.question: Do you trade your own capital?
items.answer: Company principals may trade independently, subject to internal policies.

items.question: Is past performance published?
items.answer: No. Past performance is not promoted as an indicator of future results.

items.question: How do you ensure analytical quality?
items.answer: Quality is maintained through documented methodologies and senior oversight.

items.question: Can services be terminated?
items.answer: Yes. Cooperation can be terminated according to contractual terms.

items.question: What happens if market conditions change?
items.answer: Analysis is updated to reflect evolving market structures.

items.question: Do you provide legal or tax advice?
items.answer: No. We do not provide legal or tax advice.

items.question: Are clients required to follow your analysis?
items.answer: No. Clients are free to make independent decisions.

items.question: Is there a conflict with broker services?
items.answer: No. We are independent from brokerage execution services.

items.question: How can I start working with Waves Logix?
items.answer: You can contact us to discuss your requirements and eligibility.

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.introduction: These Terms of Use govern your access to and use of the website and services provided by Waves Logix Ltd. By accessing or using our services, you agree to be bound by these terms. If you do not agree, please do not use our services.

sections.title: Scope of Services
sections.content: Waves Logix Ltd. provides analytical and advisory services related to Forex, gold, and oil markets. Our services are informational and advisory in nature and do not constitute regulated investment advice, asset management, or brokerage services.

sections.title: Eligibility
sections.content: Our services are intended for professional traders, high-net-worth individuals, and institutional clients. By using our services, you represent that you meet the applicable eligibility requirements and that use of our services is lawful in your jurisdiction.

sections.title: No Investment Advice
sections.content: All information, analysis, and recommendations provided by Waves Logix are for informational and educational purposes only. They do not constitute investment advice or a recommendation to buy or sell any financial instrument. All trading and investment decisions are your sole responsibility.

sections.title: Risk Disclosure
sections.content: Trading in Forex, gold, oil, and other financial instruments involves significant risk of loss. Past performance does not guarantee future results. You should carefully consider your financial situation and risk tolerance before engaging with financial markets.

sections.title: Intellectual Property
sections.content: All content, analysis, reports, and materials provided by Waves Logix are the intellectual property of Waves Logix Ltd. Unauthorized reproduction, distribution, or commercial use is strictly prohibited.

sections.title: Client Funds
sections.content: Waves Logix does not accept, hold, manage, or have custody of client funds. All client capital remains under the client's full control within their own brokerage account at all times.

sections.title: Limitation of Liability
sections.content: Waves Logix Ltd. shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the use of our services or reliance on any information provided. Our maximum liability is limited to the fees paid for the specific service in question.

sections.title: Termination
sections.content: Either party may terminate the advisory relationship in accordance with the terms of the applicable service agreement. Waves Logix reserves the right to refuse or discontinue services at its discretion.

sections.title: Governing Law
sections.content: These Terms of Use are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Saint Lucia. Any disputes arising from these terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Saint Lucia.

sections.title: Amendments
sections.content: Waves Logix reserves the right to update or modify these Terms of Use at any time. Continued use of our services after modifications constitutes acceptance of the revised terms.

terms.contactNote: For questions regarding these Terms of Use, please contact us via Telegram or through the contact form on our website.

kycAml.title: KYC / AML Policy
kycAml.introduction: Waves Logix Ltd. is committed to maintaining the highest standards of compliance with Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) regulations. This policy outlines our procedures for client identification, verification, and ongoing monitoring.

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: This policy establishes the framework for preventing money laundering, terrorist financing, and other financial crimes. Waves Logix is committed to operating in full compliance with applicable international anti-money laundering laws and regulations.

sections.title: Client Identification
sections.content: All prospective clients are required to provide valid identification documentation before the commencement of services. This may include government-issued identification, proof of address, and documentation verifying the source of funds where applicable.

sections.title: Verification Procedures
sections.content: Waves Logix conducts verification procedures proportionate to the risk profile of each client. Enhanced due diligence may be applied for higher-risk clients or jurisdictions. Verification is completed before advisory services are initiated.

sections.title: Ongoing Monitoring
sections.content: Client relationships are subject to ongoing monitoring. Waves Logix reserves the right to request updated documentation and to conduct periodic reviews of client information to ensure continued compliance.

sections.title: Suspicious Activity
sections.content: Waves Logix has internal procedures for identifying and reporting suspicious activity. All employees and associates are trained to recognize indicators of money laundering and financial crime. Suspicious transactions are reported to the relevant authorities as required by law.

sections.title: Politically Exposed Persons
sections.content: Enhanced due diligence procedures are applied to Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) and their close associates. Additional scrutiny is applied to the source of funds and the nature of the business relationship.

sections.title: Record Keeping
sections.content: All client identification documents, transaction records, and compliance records are maintained for a minimum period as required by applicable law. Records are stored securely and accessible only to authorized personnel.

sections.title: Sanctions Screening
sections.content: Waves Logix screens all clients against applicable international sanctions lists, including but not limited to those maintained by the United Nations, European Union, and the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC).

sections.title: Non-Compliance
sections.content: Waves Logix reserves the right to refuse or terminate services to any individual or entity that fails to comply with KYC/AML requirements, provides false or misleading information, or is reasonably suspected of involvement in financial crime.

sections.title: Policy Updates
sections.content: This policy is reviewed and updated periodically to reflect changes in regulatory requirements and best practices. Clients will be notified of material changes that affect their obligations.

kycAml.contactNote: For questions regarding our KYC/AML procedures, please contact us via Telegram or through the contact form on our website.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.introduction: Waves Logix Ltd. is committed to protecting the privacy and personal data of our clients and website visitors. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal information.

sections.title: Information We Collect
sections.content: We may collect personal information including your name, email address, phone number, identification documents (for KYC purposes), and communication records. We also collect technical data such as IP addresses, browser type, and usage analytics through standard web technologies.

sections.title: How We Use Your Information
sections.content: Personal information is used to provide and improve our services, communicate with you, fulfill legal and compliance obligations (including KYC/AML), and ensure the security of our platform. We do not use personal data for automated decision-making or profiling.

sections.title: Data Sharing
sections.content: Waves Logix does not sell, rent, or share your personal information with third parties for marketing purposes. Data may be shared with regulatory authorities where required by law, or with service providers who assist in operating our business under strict confidentiality agreements.

sections.title: Data Security
sections.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. These measures are reviewed and updated regularly.

sections.title: Data Retention
sections.content: Personal data is retained for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by applicable law. Client records are retained for the minimum period mandated by financial regulations.

sections.title: Your Rights
sections.content: You have the right to access, correct, or request deletion of your personal data, subject to legal and regulatory obligations. You may also request information about how your data is processed. To exercise these rights, please contact us directly.

sections.title: Cookies and Tracking
sections.content: Our website uses essential cookies for functionality (such as language preferences). We may use analytics tools to understand website usage patterns. You can manage cookie preferences through your browser settings.

sections.title: International Transfers
sections.content: As an international firm, your data may be processed in jurisdictions outside your country of residence. We ensure that appropriate safeguards are in place to protect your data in accordance with applicable privacy laws.

sections.title: Children's Privacy
sections.content: Our services are not directed to individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from minors.

sections.title: Policy Changes
sections.content: Waves Logix reserves the right to update this Privacy Policy at any time. Material changes will be communicated through our website. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

privacy.contactNote: For privacy-related inquiries or to exercise your data rights, please contact us via Telegram or through the contact form on our website.
